text: United Airlines is all

about connecting people
and uniting the world.
We move about 500,000 customers a day
to about 460 airports around the world.
We're really about connecting people
to the moments that matter most.
United's all in on AWS.

Our customer platforms have
all transitioned over to AWS.

And as part of that transition,
we really focused on,
how do we eliminate the need for our teams
to focus on infrastructure.
The project that we partnered on with AWS

was focused on a feature
in the United mobile app
that we called delays and cancels.
Our customers were telling us,
in the case of inclement weather,
of course we can't control the weather,
but they would love

to control their travel
experience with United.
We came up with the idea
and took it all the way to implementation
in less than 60 days.
The ability to scale up for our customers

and be able to handle
the volume of customers

that need this capability is
one of the huge advantages
of using ECS and Fargate.

The scale that we're able to
achieve when it's a stormy day
and then being able to scale down
and save when it's a blue sky day

is one of the huge
opportunities that we have.
What that means is faster speed to market,
more features for our customers.

And so using serverless
technology really helps us
to focus on the thing that matters most,
which is our customers,

and not need to focus on
the technology behind it.

And we're really fortunate
to have been on this journey

with AWS and have the
capability that we need
to really support that massive growth
we're going to have at United
over the next four to five years.
